items.title: The ups and downs of the iPhone 16E
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The iPhone 16E offers a modern processor, good camera, and appealing design at a lower price point compared to typical new devices.
- It lacks some features found in other iPhones, like MagSafe and multiple cameras, raising questions about its target market.
- The Vergecast discusses Apple's pricing strategies, the significance of the new C1 modem, and other recent tech news, including the demise of the Humane AI Pin and updates on various gadgets.

items.title: There’s Nothing left to hide as leaked videos reveal the Phone 3A in full
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- New leaks reveal the designs and specs of the Nothing Phone 3A and 3A Pro.  
- Both models have similar designs with a semi-transparent body and Glyph lighting.  
- The primary difference is in the camera arrangement; the 3A has a horizontal layout while the 3A Pro has a spiral design.  
- Both phones feature a Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 processor and 6.77-inch 120Hz AMOLED displays.  
- Camera specs include a 50MP main and an 8MP ultrawide, with the Pro having a 3x periscope and the 3A a 2x telephoto lens.  
- Front camera: Pro has 50MP; 3A has 32MP.  
- Official launch set for March 4th amidst Mobile World Congress.

items.title: Walmart recalls Swagtron scooter after its battery set an apartment on fire
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Almost 18,000 Swagtron electric scooters recalled due to fire risks from lithium-ion batteries.
- Seven reports of batteries overheating and causing burns and property damage, including a significant apartment fire.
- Affected models sold at Walmart and Sam’s Club between May 2018 and October 2024, with refunds being offered to customers.
- Consumers advised to stop using the scooters and follow hazardous waste disposal procedures.
- Swagtron has not issued a recall and has not responded to CPSC requests regarding the product.

items.title: Fortnite’s new season has heists, pickles, and Cowboy Bebop
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Fortnite Chapter 6: Season 2, dubbed "Lawless", features a heist theme with new gameplay elements like bank vaults and armored car robberies.
- Introduces new locations including "Crime City" and features like gold water for powers and a fictional cryptocurrency.
- A new battle pass includes themed criminals and ties to Cowboy Bebop with specific quests starting March 1st.
- The season runs from today until May 2nd, 2024, and includes various gameplay expansions like local multiplayer and new game modes.

items.title: Elon Musk's Surprising Appearance at CPAC
items.author: Sarah Jeong
items.summary:
- Elon Musk appeared at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), giving an unusual interview with Newsmax host Rob Schmitt.
- Musk's comments included proclaiming "I am become meme" and promoting the idea of 'Legalize Comedy!'.
- He discussed the shift in political culture, expressing support for President Trump and criticizing censorship and cancel culture.
- Musk highlighted that he felt compelled to speak out due to perceived threats to freedom of speech and personal liberties in America.
- The event featured a humorous moment where Argentine President Javier Milei presented Musk with a chainsaw to symbolize cutting bureaucracy.

items.title: Reddit is reportedly experiencing some outages
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
• Reddit is facing "international outages" as reported by NetBlocks, a global internet monitor.
• There have been over 47,000 outage reports on Downdetector as of the latest updates.
• Users have reported issues on various platforms, but some, like the author, have not experienced problems.
• Reddit's status page indicates that all systems are currently "operational."

items.title: Here are the best Apple Watch deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Apple launched its latest smartwatch, the [Apple Watch Series 10](https://www.theverge.com/21289209/best-apple-watch-deals), alongside a black version of the Ultra 2 in September.
- The Series 10 features a larger OLED display, a thinner design, and a new S10 SiP chip compared to previous models.
- Series 10 prices are starting at $329 for the 42mm version on Amazon and Walmart, with discounts of $70.
- The [Apple Watch Series 9](https://www.theverge.com/21289209/best-apple-watch-deals) is available starting at $249, with $180 off, at Walmart.
- The second-generation Apple Watch SE, which features the same chipset as the Series 8, starts at $199.
- The rugged Apple Watch Ultra 2 starts at $749 with offers available through Amazon and Best Buy; it has a brighter display and improved performance compared to its predecessor.

items.title: Google may be close to launching YouTube Premium Lite
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- YouTube is launching a cheaper, ad-free version called Premium Lite in the US, Australia, Germany, and Thailand.
- This version aims at viewers who prefer content other than music videos, with no disclosed price yet.
- YouTube had previously piloted Premium Lite in Europe but discontinued it in 2023.
- The company is testing a new version, boasting some videos ad-free, with a reported trial price of $8.99 AUD per month.

items.title: Carbon removal is the next big fossil fuel boom, oil company says
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Occidental Petroleum views carbon dioxide capture as a significant future for fossil fuel production.
- The company has established a carbon capture division that is involved in projects supported by major corporations and the Biden administration.
- Occidental plans to use captured CO2 in enhanced oil recovery, potentially increasing reserves by 50 to 70 billion barrels.
- Direct air capture remains economically challenging, costing hundreds of dollars per ton of CO2, with future viability depending on ongoing government support.
- Agreements with Microsoft and Amazon for carbon removal include conditions for permanent sequestration, avoiding further fossil fuel production.

items.title: Fitbit’s got a battery problem
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Fitbit Versa 3 and Sense owners received a mandatory firmware update to address overheating batteries.
- The update aims to reduce the risk of overheating but leads to significantly decreased battery life for some users, lasting only a day instead of 2-6 days.
- Affected users are offered a $50 credit, but many find it insufficient given the diminished functionality of their devices.
- Previous battery issues with Fitbit products have resulted in fines and legal actions against the company, including $12 million for overheating Ionic watches.
- The situation highlights ongoing battery complaints and customer support challenges for Fitbit users, particularly post-Google acquisition.

items.title: Rivian reports first quarter of ‘positive gross profit’
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Rivian reported its first positive gross profit in Q4 2024, amounting to $170 million on $1.7 billion in revenue.
- The net loss for Q4 2024 was $743 million, an improvement from $1.5 billion in Q4 2023.
- For the full year of 2024, Rivian's revenue was $4.5 billion with a net loss of $4.7 billion, down from $5.4 billion in 2023.
- The increase in revenue was partly due to a $260 million rise in regulatory credit sales.
- Rivian projects vehicle sales between 46,000 and 51,000 for 2025, expecting modest gross profit despite a challenging demand environment.
- The company is launching sales of its electric delivery van to all commercial fleet owners and has introduced a special edition R1 vehicle.

items.title: Adidas plugs its website and app into Amazon’s ‘Buy with Prime’ program
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Adidas will integrate Amazon's 'Buy with Prime' into its website and app starting in spring.
- US Amazon Prime subscribers can receive free shipping and streamlined returns on adidas.com and the Adidas app.
- By logging into their Amazon account at checkout, items will be fulfilled by Amazon, improving purchase tracking and delivery speed.
- Adidas joins other brands like Belkin and Steve Madden in the direct-to-consumer Buy with Prime program, enhancing Amazon's brand partnerships.

items.title: The busiest US airline now supports Apple’s AirTag location sharing
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- American Airlines adds support for Apple’s Share Item Location feature for luggage tracking using AirTags.
- This feature enhances the chances of reunification with lost luggage for over 226 million passengers transported by the airline last year.
- Share Item Location allows users to create a shareable link in the Find My app, which shows the last known location of the lost item. Links expire after seven days and can be deactivated once the item is found.
- Other airlines like United, Delta, and Air Canada have also implemented this feature for lost luggage tracking.

items.title: The Verge’s favorite kitchen gadgets
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Verge staff shared their favorite kitchen gadgets and tools.
- Gadgets include both powered items like electric kettles and blenders, and non-powered tools such as spreader knives and wooden spoons.
- Electric kettles are praised for their speed and convenience, especially for parents.
- An automatic soap dispenser helps reduce waste and provides measured amounts of soap.
- The Presto PopLite air popper is recommended for making delicious popcorn easily.
- Instant Pot is highlighted for its versatility and efficiency in cooking various dishes.
- Immersion blenders are favored for their quick setup and easy clean-up after blending.
- A meat thermometer is essential for precise cooking, with recommendations for reliable brands.
- A food chopper saves time in meal preparation for chopping ingredients like ginger.
- Spreading knives are appreciated for their multi-functionality in meal preparation and serving.

items.title: Nickelodeon’s next Avatar animated series is finally coming together
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nickelodeon announced the new animated series “Avatar: Seven Havens” co-created by Michael DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko.
- The series will consist of 2 seasons with 13 half-hour episodes each.
- The plot involves a new earthbending Avatar viewed as a threat, who must save the Seven Havens alongside her long-lost twin.
- The announcement comes following creative differences that led to DiMartino and Konietzko leaving the Netflix adaptation of “The Last Airbender”.
- Potential narrative connections to an upcoming movie focused on Aang are hinted, but details are scarce.

items.title: DJI’s RS 4 Mini camera stabilizer can now track moving people
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- DJI has released the RS 4 Mini camera stabilizer, a compact and lighter version designed for smaller cameras and smartphones.
- The RS 4 Mini features an upgraded subject tracking module which can autonomously track moving subjects from over 32 feet away.
- Weighing 890 grams, it can support cameras up to 4.4 pounds and has a battery life of up to 13 hours.
- Prices: RS 4 Mini - $369, RS 4 Mini Combo - $459, RS 4 Mini Creator Combo - $478.

items.title: The evolution of Twitter to X under Elon Musk
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
• X will charge new users in certain countries $1 per year.
• Concerns raised about ad revenue sharing payments for users.
• Elon Musk expresses desire for a second chance at leading X.
• The 'X' sign atop the former Twitter HQ has been taken down.
• Stakeholders discuss how X is impacting conversations and outcomes nationally.
• A settlement of about $10 million has been reached with Trump regarding a lawsuit.
• Trump's lawsuit against Twitter, relating to his account suspension, has been dismissed previously.

items.title: Kia unveils PV5 electric van as a futuristic people-mover
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Kia revealed the exterior design of the PV5 electric van, its first EV under the 'Platform Before Vehicle' (PBV) brand.
- The PV5 aims to compete with the Volkswagen ID Buzz, Ford E-Transit, and others, and will offer various configurations for cargo delivery, rideshare, or personal use.
- No details on the powertrain, range, price, or availability were provided, but the PV5 is designed for modularity, accommodating diverse vehicle types.
- Uber has partnered with Kia to include the PV5 for drivers, supporting its commitment to an all-electric fleet by 2040.
- More details about the PV5 and a new model will be revealed at Kia EV Day in Spain later this month.

items.title: iPhone 16E: all the news on Apple’s new $599 phone
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple has announced the iPhone 16E, an update to the iPhone SE, featuring a new design with a Face ID-enabled notch.
- It includes Apple's first in-house 5G modem, the C1, described as the most power-efficient modem ever on an iPhone.
- The phone has a 6.06-inch OLED display, customizable Action Button, A18 chipset, and a single 48MP rear camera.
- Launch date is set for February 28, with preorders starting on February 21, available in white and black with storage options of 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB at $599.
- Notable feature changes include a USB-C port instead of Lightning, and no MagSafe support or Dynamic Island display.

items.title: Apple is bringing Visual Intelligence to the iPhone 15 Pro
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple’s Visual Intelligence tool will be available on the iPhone 15 Pro in a future software update.
- Visual Intelligence allows users to learn about objects by pointing their camera at them, similar to Google Lens.
- The feature was first introduced with the iPhone 16 lineup and will be accessible via the Action Button on the iPhone 15 Pro.
- Users can also launch the feature from the Control Center.
- The specific update for this feature has not been revealed, but it may be part of iOS 18.4, expected for public release in early April.

items.title: The best deals on MacBooks right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Apple has discontinued the M1 MacBook Air but it is still available at some retailers starting at $649.
- The M1 MacBook Air is currently priced at $629 at Walmart, $370 off its original price.
- Refurbished MacBooks via Apple's store offer up to 20% discounts with a one-year warranty.
- The M2 MacBook Air is available at Amazon starting at $899, $100 off for 16GB RAM and 256GB storage.
- The new M3 MacBook Air starts at $1,099 and offers improved performance and battery life.
- Previous-gen M3 MacBook Pro models are available at significant discounts, currently starting at $1,199 on Best Buy.

items.title: Among Us 3D will let you deduce from a first-person perspective
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Developer Innersloth announced a new game, Among Us 3D, allowing players to engage in a first-person deduction experience.
- Launch will include cross-platform play between PC and various VR headsets, such as Meta Quest and PlayStation VR 2.
- A demo will be available during Steam Next Fest; however, no release date for the full game is specified.
- A new in-game currency, "stardust," will be introduced for cosmetic purchases, not affecting game modes or features.

items.title: Here are the best Kindle deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon offers various Kindle models with sales and discounts, including the standard Kindle, Kindle Kids, Kindle Paperwhite, and Kindle Scribe.
- The new Kindle (2024) starts at $109.99 with improved features compared to its predecessor, including a brighter display.
- Kindle Kids (2024) costs $129.99, includes accessories and six months of Amazon Kids Plus.
- The Kindle Paperwhite (2024) has a seven-inch display, improved performance, and starts at $159.99.
- The premium Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition is available for $199.99, featuring wireless charging and enhanced storage capabilities.
- Various bundle deals available for Kindle devices, including themed covers and extended warranties.

items.title: How to master decision making in a world of uncertainty
items.author: Vox Creative
items.summary:
- The article discusses the pervasive uncertainty in today's world affecting personal and professional decision-making.
- A study by HSBC and Professor David Tuckett introduces a model to improve decision-making amidst uncertainty.
- It emphasizes the importance of mindset, encouraging optimism and adaptability in decision-making processes.
- Good decision-making is presented as a learned skill rather than an innate ability.

items.title: Amazon’s Appstore is pulling Android support
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Amazon is ending Android support for its Appstore on August 20, 2025.
- The Appstore will still be available on Fire TV and Tablet devices.
- Apps downloaded will not disappear but may not operate after the cutoff.
- Microsoft will cease support for Amazon’s Appstore on Windows on March 5, 2024.
- Amazon Coins program will end; no new coins can be purchased after February 20, 2025.
- Refunds for remaining coins after August 20 will be provided later.

items.title: Apple’s Murderbot series starts streaming in May
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Apple announces the premiere date for its adaptation of *Murderbot*, based on Martha Wells' novels, on May 16th with two episodes.
- The season finale will be available on July 11th.
- Alexander Skarsgård stars as the lead character, a self-hacking security construct with an aversion to human emotion.
- The series is directed by Chris and Paul Weitz, with David S. Goyer as an executive producer.
- Additional cast includes Noma Dumezweni, David Dastmalchian, and others.

items.title: Microsoft prepares for OpenAI’s GPT-5 model
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft engineers are preparing server capacity for OpenAI’s GPT-4.5 and GPT-5 models.
- GPT-4.5 is expected to launch in weeks, with Microsoft anticipating hosting as early as next week.
- OpenAI plans to release GPT-5 in late May, promising significant technological advancements.
- GPT-5 aims to unify OpenAI’s technologies, incorporating the new o3 reasoning model.
- Upcoming AI announcements from Microsoft are expected around the Build developer conference in May.

items.title: GTA V’s next-gen console upgrades are coming to PC
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Grand Theft Auto V on PC will receive upgrades previously added to PS5 and Xbox Series X/S via a free update on March 4th.
- New features include PC-exclusive ray tracing, support for FSR1, FSR3, and DLSS 3, faster loading times, enhanced resolutions, and support for Dolby Atmos.
- GTA Online will have new vehicles and upgrades, but the original GTA Online version will be split from the upgraded version, preventing cross-play between the two.

items.title: The standard iPhone needs ProMotion more than ever
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple aims to attract price-sensitive customers with the new iPhone 16E, similar to the iPhone SE.
- The iPhone 16E features an OLED display, FaceID, the latest processor, and a customizable Action Button, but lacks a dual-camera setup.
- Apple needs to differentiate the standard iPhone from the Pro models more clearly, potentially by introducing a 120Hz ProMotion display.
- Competing brands like Google and Samsung offer high-refresh rate displays in more affordable models, challenging Apple's pricing strategy.
- A 120Hz display would enhance user experience with smoother scrolling and functionality such as always-on display mode.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: key impacts on the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Trump administration plans significant layoffs, targeting the Office of Community Planning and Development, affecting disaster relief efforts in North Carolina after Hurricane Helene.
- Resignation of US Digital Service leader Anne Marshall after major staff cuts by Musk's DOGE, highlighting efficiency concerns.
- Trump and Musk's bond discussed in a Fox News interview, with Trump claiming to have given Musk a discount during their settlements.
- Cancellation of NYC congestion pricing approval by the Trump administration, which had been set to raise transit funds and reduce traffic.
- New executive order by Trump for closer oversight of independent agencies, stirring controversy over presidential control over regulatory actions.
- DOGE's reported miscalculations in cost savings lead to criticism and concerns over access to taxpayer data.

items.title: Leaked details reveal potential pricing for Lego’s Nintendo Game Boy
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Lego Nintendo Game Boy is expected to release in October 2025.
- Leaked pricing is set at $59.99 for 421 pieces, translating to approximately 14 cents per brick.
- The set number is 72046, aligning with previous leaks about Lego’s collaboration with Nintendo.

items.title: Jeep’s parent company announces ‘hands free, eyes off’ driving feature
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Stellantis introduces STLA AutoDrive, a partial autonomous driving feature aimed at easing stop-and-go traffic.
- The feature is developed but not yet launched due to market and regulatory hurdles, with no specific models announced.
- STLA AutoDrive can operate hands-free at speeds below 60 km/h (37 mph) and is designed to evolve with technological advancements.
- The system includes advanced sensors and is intended for low-speed scenarios, though concerns about driver attention remain.
- Automakers, including Mercedes-Benz and Ford, are pursuing Level 3 features, yet few are available due to regulations and safety caution.

items.title: Amazon now has creative control over the James Bond franchise
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Amazon, MGM, and Bond producers announced a new joint venture for creative control over the James Bond franchise.
- Producers Barbara Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson plan to step back from the franchise after the deal.
- Previous tensions existed between Broccoli and Amazon regarding the franchise's future direction.
- Jeff Bezos publicly asked for suggestions on who should be the next James Bond following the announcement.

items.title: Our Favorite Things: Gear, Gadgets, and Other Stuff
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Overview of favorite gadgets and gear recommended by Verge staff.
- Staff members discuss their preferred social networks post-Twitter's transition to X.
- The article features various categories including social networks, home office items, audio gear, board games, gardening gadgets, and mobile phone accessories.
- Each section highlights the personal favorites of the staff, detailing why they like specific items and how they are used.

items.title: Skylight Calendar Max review: a game-changer for busy parents
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The Skylight Calendar Max features an AI-powered planning assistant called Sidekick.
- It can sync schedules from various sources to Google Calendar and family calendars.
- Product price starts from $569.99 for the 27-inch model.
- The calendar is designed to help families manage busy schedules more effectively.
- The Skylight Calendar Max has a 2560 x 1440 resolution touchscreen display.
- The AI Sidekick can convert messages and images into calendar entries, saving parents time and effort.
- The product has received mixed feedback regarding its integration and subscription model.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass was supposed to be the Netflix of gaming — what happened?
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Xbox Game Pass launched in 2017, aiming to create a Netflix-like gaming experience.
- Despite some success, Xbox still ranks third in console sales behind Sony and Nintendo.
- Microsoft’s gaming strategy has shifted towards subscription and cloud services, yet they face ongoing challenges in hardware and game distribution.
- Game Pass hasn't transformed the industry as expected, with many consumers still purchasing games traditionally.
- The podcast discusses the implications of Microsoft's strategy and the future of gaming.

items.title: iPhone 16 Pro versus Galaxy S25 Ultra: which camera is better?
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
• Samsung announced the Galaxy S25 series, including the S25 Ultra, at the Unpacked event last month.
• Key features of the S25 Ultra include a 50-megapixel ultrawide lens, LOG video, and AI audio processing.
• The iPhone 16 Pro, released in September 2024, has similar features to the S25 Ultra.
• A review by Vjeran Pavic from The Verge compares both devices on noise, color, sound, and ease of use.

items.title: The Dune survival game launches in May, but you can build a character now
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Developer Funcom announced that *Dune: Awakening* will launch on Steam on May 20th.
- A character creator is available, allowing players to customize appearance, home planet, caste, and mentor, which affects starting abilities.
- A benchmark mode is also launched to test system performance, featuring scenes from the game such as flying with an ornithopter and encountering a sandworm.
- Both tools are available for free on Steam.

items.title: Scuf’s Valor Pro is a promising start for its Hall effect Xbox controllers
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Scuf launched the $99.99 Valor Pro, its first wired controller approaching a budget price.
- The controller is available in 15 styles and is designed for both Xbox and PC.
- Features Hall effect thumb sticks to reduce stick drift, four programmable rear buttons, and adjustable game volume/chat mix dials.
- Ergonomically designed, with refined bumpers and rear paddles for easier access during gameplay.
- Supports a future update for a 1KHz polling rate for reduced input lag, beneficial for PC gamers.
- Compared to alternatives, it’s less customizable than the Xbox Elite Series 2 but more affordable.
- Contenders like the PowerA Fusion Pro offer similar features at lower prices but may lack the classic Xbox feel.

items.title: Spotify is making it easier to release audiobooks narrated by AI
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Spotify partners with ElevenLabs to accept AI-narrated audiobooks, expanding its audiobook market.
- Previously, AI audiobooks were allowed but with restrictions; now the process is more streamlined.
- ElevenLabs provides narration in 32 languages with varying synthetic voices, offering a cost-effective solution for authors.

items.title: Canon’s new PowerShot V1 puts video first
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Canon has launched the PowerShot V1, aimed at video content creators, featuring a wide-angle lens and a new sensor.
- It introduces customizable video "moods", a product demo mode with priority autofocus, and can record 4K/60p for over two hours due to a built-in cooling fan.
- Announced before the CP+ photography show, it is set to launch in late April 2025 in Asia, with pricing around $990 (148,500 yen) and wider availability to be confirmed.
- The camera has a 22.3-megapixel capability, with 15fps mechanical shutter and 30fps electronic options, but applies a 1.4x crop for 4K/60p video.
- Features include a 16-50mm f/2.8-4.5 zoom lens, Dual Pixel AF II system for advanced autofocus, and a vari-angle touchscreen for control, lacking an electronic viewfinder.

items.title: Twelve South’s Find My-compatible charger is on sale starting at just $49
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Twelve South PlugBug is a USB-C wall charger that can function with Apple's Find My network.
- Available for $49 (50W version) and $79.35 (120W version), with significant discounts.
- The charger features multiple USB-C ports for charging multiple devices simultaneously.
- It can help users locate the device through alerts and beeping sounds, enhancing usability while traveling.

items.title: Ring's New Outdoor Security Camera Offers 2K Video Right Out of the Box
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Ring has launched the Outdoor Cam Plus, its first outdoor security camera with 2K video support at launch.
- The camera features improved Wi-Fi and low-light capabilities, with real-time alerts and live streaming.
- Priced at $99.99, it will ship on March 26, 2025, and offers subscription-based features starting at $4.99/month for advanced functionalities.

items.title: This smart thermostat company is considering charging users for its app
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Tado is contemplating a £1 / €1 monthly charge for app usage starting May 1, 2025.
- Users reported receiving notifications about the fee, with some seeing differing start dates for the charge.
- The charge is attributed to increased company costs; free integration with smart home platforms will remain.
- Tado currently has optional subscription fees for additional services, but app control has been free.
- Tado claims the notifications may be part of marketing tests, assuring users that no charges are currently enforced.
- The potential implementation of this fee could risk customer retention and product recommendations.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article covers the latest developments in smart home technology, including reviews and guides from companies like Apple, Amazon, Samsung, and Google.
- Users have reported that Tado plans to charge a monthly fee to control their smart thermostats via their app, starting in 2025.
- Eufy launched the FamiLock S3 Max, a smart lock that uses palm vein recognition.
- Apple is rumored to be developing a home robot that may take the form of a lamp.
- Research indicates users may not fully understand the security implications of outdated smart appliances.

items.title: It’s clearly time: all the news about the transparent tech renaissance
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Leaked images reveal a transparent color option for Sony’s upcoming ANC earbuds, the WF-C710N, expected in late May.
- Retro Remake has opened preorders for the SuperStation One, a PS One clone, with a Founders Edition sold out and standard edition available for $179.99.
- Xbox is launching the Pulse Cipher Special Edition controller featuring a deep-red transparent casing for $74.99.
- Asus announced its first Thunderbolt 5 external GPU, promising high power and connectivity for portable setups.
- Hyperkin is releasing a translucent green version of its Xbox Controller S, priced at $49.99, with details on availability pending.
- Anbernic launched the RG34XX Game Boy Advance clone with transparent color options and additional features for retro gaming.

items.title: The iPhone is done with home buttons — here’s why I’ll miss it
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple has announced the iPhone 16E, the first model without a home button since the iPhone's launch in 2007.
- The home button played a crucial role in the original iPhone, making it accessible for users new to smartphones.
- Over the years, the home button evolved to include features like Siri access and Touch ID, demonstrating its importance.
- The design of smartphones has progressed, leading to the decision to remove the home button for a more modern, full-screen experience.
- While users adapted to new navigation methods, the home button will be remembered for its legacy in smartphone innovation.

items.title: Oppo’s new foldable can remote control a Mac
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo launched the Find N5, the thinnest book-style foldable phone available outside of China.
- The phone can connect to a Mac for file transfers and remote control through the O Plus Connect app.
- Users can browse and transfer files wirelessly between the phone and Mac as long as both are on the same Wi-Fi network.
- The remote control feature allows the phone to mirror the Mac's display, enabling a miniature laptop experience.
- Oppo's feature is a first for the brand, while a similar option was introduced by Vivo in April 2024 but is only available on China-exclusive devices.
- Plans to expand this feature to more Oppo phones are announced, though details are pending.

items.title: Oppo Find N5 review: the final evolution of foldables
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo's Find N5 is regarded as the pinnacle of foldable phones, with no clear direction for future development.
- It features a thickness of 8.93mm when closed, making it the thinnest foldable phone to date and just 4.21mm when open.
- Equipped with a 5,600mAh battery and supports 50W wireless charging; features Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset for better efficiency.
- Offers impressive hardware specifications including an 8.12-inch main display with a nearly invisible crease.
- Cameras include a 50MP main and 3x telephoto, but the 8MP ultrawide is lacking; doesn’t launch in the US market; priced around $1,867.

items.title: The world’s thinnest foldable phone doesn’t come cheap
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo has launched the Find N5, the thinnest foldable phone in the world, priced at $2,499 SGD (around $1,867 USD).
- The phone is slimmer than rivals, measuring 8.93mm when closed and 4.21mm at its thinnest point when open.
- It features an IPX6, X8, and X9 rating for water resistance but lacks dust protection.
- The display has a narrower and shallower crease to enhance usability.
- It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, 16GB of RAM, and 512GB of storage.
- The Find N5 has impressive Hasselblad-branded cameras, including a 50MP main lens.
- Available in Europe and Asia, confirmed for a February 28 release in Singapore, but not launching in the US.
